knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

```{r libraries, message = FALSE, cache=TRUE}
library(GEOquery)
library(preprocessCore)
library(SummarizedExperiment)
library(limma)
library(dplyr)
library(illuminaHumanv3.db) # Illumina HumanHT-12 V3.0 expression beadchip
```

## Read in Non-normalized data
```{r, cache = TRUE}
urls <- getGEOSuppFiles("GSE19435", fetch_files = FALSE)
url_cel <- as.character(urls$url[1])
temp <- tempfile()
tempd <- tempdir()
download.file(url_cel,temp)
untar(temp,exdir = tempd)
#untar('GSE19435/GSE19435_RAW.tar', exdir="GSE19435/GSE19435_Raw")
files <- list.files(tempd, pattern = "txt.*");files
GSE19435_Non_normalized_list <- lapply(files, function(x) read.delim(paste0(tempd,'/',x), header=TRUE, col.names = c('ID_REF',gsub('_.*','',x),paste0(gsub('_.*','',x),'.Pval')), stringsAsFactors = FALSE))
```

## Check the names of ID_REF in each dataset
```{r}
GSE19435_Non_normalized_list_ID <- sapply(GSE19435_Non_normalized_list, function(x) x[,1]) %>% data.frame()

# check they have identical ID_REF
check_1 <- sapply(1:ncol(GSE19435_Non_normalized_list_ID),function(x) all(GSE19435_Non_normalized_list_ID[,1]==GSE19435_Non_normalized_list_ID[,x]));check_1

GSE19435_Non_normalized_sub1 <- do.call(cbind,GSE19435_Non_normalized_list[which(check_1)])
GSE19435_Non_normalized_sub1 <- GSE19435_Non_normalized_sub1[,-which(colnames(GSE19435_Non_normalized_sub1)=='ID_REF')[-1]]

#####################
# Check FALSE part
GSE19435_dat1 <- GSE19435_Non_normalized_list[-which(check_1)]
GSE19435_dat1_ID <- sapply(GSE19435_dat1, function(x) x[,1]) %>% data.frame()
check_2 <- sapply(1:ncol(GSE19435_dat1_ID),function(x) all(GSE19435_dat1_ID[,3]==GSE19435_dat1_ID[,x]));check_2

GSE19435_Non_normalized_sub2 <- do.call(cbind,GSE19435_dat1[which(check_2)])
GSE19435_Non_normalized_sub2 <- GSE19435_Non_normalized_sub2[,-which(colnames(GSE19435_Non_normalized_sub2)=='ID_REF')[-1]]

# Left two datasets with ID_REF differnt from each other and the two sub datasets
# Combine two large datasets and two small datasets
GSE19435_Non_normalized <- GSE19435_Non_normalized_sub1 %>% inner_join(GSE19435_Non_normalized_sub2,by= c('ID_REF'="ID_REF")) %>% inner_join(GSE19435_dat1[-which(check_2)][[1]],by= c('ID_REF'="ID_REF")) %>% inner_join(GSE19435_dat1[-which(check_2)][[2]],by= c('ID_REF'="ID_REF")) %>% data.frame()

row.names(GSE19435_Non_normalized) <- GSE19435_Non_normalized$ID_REF
```

```{r}
# Remove .Pval
GSE19435_Non_pvalue <- GSE19435_Non_normalized[,-c(1,grep('.Pval',colnames(GSE19435_Non_normalized)))]
GSE19435_Non_normalized_counts <- GSE19435_Non_pvalue
dim(GSE19435_Non_pvalue)
```

```{r convert ProbeID to Gene Symbol, cache=TURE}
# Annotation from vendor's information
gpl6947 <- getGEO("GPL6947", GSEMatrix =  F)
GPL6947_dat <- gpl6947@dataTable@table %>% data.frame()

# Annotation
PROBES <- row.names(GSE19435_Non_pvalue)
OUT <- AnnotationDbi::select(illuminaHumanv3.db, PROBES, "SYMBOL")
OUT[is.na(OUT)] <- NA

# Map ProbeID to Gene Symbol 
OUT_collapse <- OUT %>% group_by(PROBEID) %>% summarise(SYMBOL = paste(SYMBOL, collapse="///"), times = length(unlist(strsplit(SYMBOL, "///")))) 

GSE19435_Non_pvalue$ID_REF <- row.names(GSE19435_Non_pvalue)
GSE19435_final <- GSE19435_Non_pvalue %>% left_join(OUT_collapse, by=c('ID_REF'="PROBEID")) %>% left_join(GPL6947_dat, by = c('ID_REF'='ID')) 

row_data <- GSE19435_final %>% dplyr::select(-grep('GSM',colnames(GSE19435_final))) %>% DataFrame()
# arrange(GSE19435_final, desc(times))
```

## Create ColData
```{r get column data, cache=TRUE}
gse <- getGEO("GSE19435", GSEMatrix =  F)
data_characteristic <- lapply(1:length(GSMList(gse)), function(x)  
  GSMList(gse)[[x]]@header$characteristics_ch1)
characteristic_table <- sapply(1:length(data_characteristic[[1]]), function(x) 
  sapply(data_characteristic, '[[',x)) 
## Demo convert geographical region: Kenya to Kenya
characteristic_data_frame <- sub('(.*?): ','',characteristic_table) %>% DataFrame()
#colnames(characteristic_data_frame) <- gsub(':.*','',data_characteristic[[1]])
colnames(characteristic_data_frame) <- c('Age','Gender','Ethnicity','TBStatus','TimePostTreatment','SputumSmearStatus','IsolateSensitivity','BcgVaccinated')

characteristic_data_frame$Age <- sapply(1:nrow(characteristic_data_frame), function(x) gsub('years.*','',characteristic_data_frame$Age[x]))

indx <- sapply(1:length(names(GSMList(gse))), function(i) 
  which(names(GSMList(gse)) %in% colnames(GSE19435_Non_normalized_counts)[i]));indx
characteristic_data_frame <- characteristic_data_frame[indx,]

row.names(characteristic_data_frame) <- colnames(GSE19435_Non_normalized_counts)
head(characteristic_data_frame)
```

```{r Create RowData MetaData and summarized experiment}
# Create Metadata
GSE19435_experimentData <- new('MIAME',
                      name="Damien Chaussabel",
                      lab="Baylor Institute for Immunology Research",
                      contact="DChaussabel@benaroyaresearch.org",
                      title="An interferon-inducible neutrophil-driven blood transcriptional signature in human tuberculosis",
                      abstract="Whole blood collected in tempus tubes from patients with different spectra of TB disease and healthy controls. All patients were sampled prior to the initiation of any antimycobacterial therapy.",
                      url="10.1038/nature09247",
                      pubMedIds = '20725040',
                      other=list(Platform = 'Illumina HumanHT-12 V3.0 expression beadchip (GPL6947)'))

GSE19435_summarizedExperiemnt <- SummarizedExperiment(assays = list(GSE19435_Non_normalized_counts= as.matrix(GSE19435_Non_normalized_counts)), colData = characteristic_data_frame, rowData = row_data, metadata = list(GSE19435_experimentData)); GSE19435_summarizedExperiemnt

```

```{r}
saveRDS(GSE19435_summarizedExperiemnt, ascii=FALSE, file='GSE19435/GSE19435_summarizedExperiemnt.RDS')

```

### Make a matrix contain the NA's for the TB status cariter
#### Standard column names come from Berry GSE19444
```{r}
getwd()
geo_access <- 'GSE19435'
sobject <- readRDS(paste0(geo_access,'/',geo_access,'_summarizedExperiemnt.RDS'))
```

```{r create new column information data}
standard_name_seq <- colData(readRDS('~/Desktop/RA work/build_TB_data/Signatures/Berry/GSE19443/GSE19443_summarizedExperiemnt.RDS')) %>% data.frame() %>% colnames
new_coldata <- function(sobject){
  col_info <- colData(sobject) %>% data.frame()
  dat_NA_new <- matrix(c(rep('n.a.',length(standard_name_seq)*nrow(col_info))),ncol=length(standard_name_seq),
                             byrow=T,dimnames=list(row.names(col_info),
                                                   standard_name_seq)) %>% data.frame()
  
  # fill in with existing data
  overlap_name <- standard_name_seq[which(colnames(dat_NA_new) %in% colnames(col_info))]
  for (i in overlap_name){
    dat_NA_new[i] <- col_info[i]
  }
  
  # Append the rest of cloumns to the dataframe
  col_info_rest <- col_info %>% dplyr::select(-overlap_name)
  dat_final <- cbind(dat_NA_new,col_info_rest)
  
  return(dat_final)
}
new_col_info <- new_coldata(sobject)

```
